metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14660 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in glusterfs server through versions 4.1.4 and 3.1.2 whichallowed repeated usage of GF_META_LOCK_KEY xattr. A remote, authenticatedattacker could use this flaw to create multiple locks for single inode byusing setxattr repetitively resulting in memory exhaustion of glusterfsserver node.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14660` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-common - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-server - 4.1.4-1
libgfapi0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfchangelog0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfrpc0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfxdr0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterfs0 - 4.1.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.4-1').
